Package ch.powerunit.extensions.async.lang

Class WaitResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.powerunit.extensions.async.lang.WaitResult

  • public final class WaitResult
extends Object
    This class is the entry point for this library to support async operation inside test.

    Use one of the provided methods to repeatedly get some data, until some condition.

    Since:
    1.0.0 - Before, this class was under ch.powerunit.extensions.async. This change is linked with java 9 module, as it will not be possible to have the implementation in a sub package of the exported one., 1.1.0 - Starting from version 1.1.0, the System.Logger feature is used to do some logging of the system. One goal is to provide a way to the user to see when the system is waiting for example. Also, some methods were added to decorate Callable and Predicate to add toString to describe them.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static <T> WaitResultBuilder1<T> of​(Callable<T> action)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on the result of the received action, with repetition until some condition.

        Simple sample

         CompletableFuture<Optional<MyObject>> exec = WaitResult.of(MyObject::myCallable).expecting(MyObject::myControl)
                .repeat(10).every(10, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS).asyncExec();
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result.
        Parameters:
        action - the Callable providing the result.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null

      • of

        public static <T> WaitResultBuilder1<T> of​(Callable<T> action,
                                           Runnable actionOnFinish)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on the result of the received action, with repetition until some condition.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result.
        Parameters:
        action - the Callable providing the result.
        actionOnFinish - register an action after the result is retrieved (success or failure). This may be used to register some resource cleanup.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • ofSupplier

        public static <T> WaitResultBuilder1<T> ofSupplier​(Supplier<T> supplier)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on execution of the received action, with repetition until some condition.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the Supplier to be executed.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if supplier is null
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • ofRunnable

        public static WaitResultBuilder3<Boolean> ofRunnable​(Runnable action)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on execution of the received action, with repetition until some condition.

        In this case, it is assumed that the received action throws unchecked exception when the condition is not yet OK. The returned Optional will be present in case of success.

        Parameters:
        action - the Runnable to be executed.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • on

        public static <T> WaitResultBuilder2<T> on​(T mutableObject)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on repeated control on the mutable object.

        Simple sample

         CompletableFuture<Optional<MyObject>> exec = WaitResult.on(myObject).expecting(MyObject::myControl).repeat(100)
                .every(10, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS).asyncExec();
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result.
        Parameters:
        mutableObject - the mutable object to be checked.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder

      • onCondition

        public static WaitResultBuilder3<Boolean> onCondition​(Supplier<Boolean> conditionSupplier)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on repeated control on a method returning a boolean.
        Parameters:
        conditionSupplier - the boolean supplier
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if conditionSupplier is null

      • forException

        public static WaitResultBuilder3<Exception> forException​(Callable<?> action)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on repeated control of a call that is assumed as OK when an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        action - the action that is expected to thrown an exception.
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • forException

        public static <T extends Exception> WaitResultBuilder1<T> forException​(Callable<?> action,
                                                                       Class<T> targetException)
        Start the builder to create an instance of CompletableFuture based on repeated control of a call that is assumed as done when a a specific exception is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected exception type
        Parameters:
        action - the action that is expected to thrown an exception.
        targetException - the expected Exception class
        Returns:
        the next step of the builder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action or targetException is null
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • callableWithToString

        public static <T> Callable<T> callableWithToString​(Callable<T> callable,
                                                   Supplier<String> toString)
        Modify a Callable to add a toString.

        The goal of this method is to provide a way to have lambda, used for example in the context of this library, that are decorated with a toString method. Later, when this Callable is used in log, it is possible to have a meaningful description and not the default toString.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the Callable
        Parameters:
        callable - the Callable to be decorated.
        toString - the Supplier to be used as toString method.
        Returns:
        the decorated Callable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if callable or toString is null.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • predicateWithToString

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateWithToString​(Predicate<T> predicate,
                                                     Supplier<String> toString)
        Modify a Predicate to add a toString.

        The goal of this method is to provide a way to have lambda, used for example in the context of this library, that are decorated with a toString method. Later, when this Predicate is used in log, it is possible to have a meaningful description and not the default toString.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the input type of the Predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate to be decorated.
        toString - the Supplier to be used as toString method.
        Returns:
        the decorated Predicate.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if predicate or toString is null.
        Since:
        1.1.0
